key_title: Key to the species of Scleranthus

source.author: Cowley, K.J.; West, J.G.
source.title: Scleranthus
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Cowley, K.J.; West, J.G. (1996). Scleranthus. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Inflorescence of solitary or paired flowers, on short or long peduncles; sepals (in fruit) less than 1 mm long, shorter than perigynous zone
Inflorescence of 1–30 flowers, sessile; sepals (in fruit) usually more than 1 mm long, usually same length as or longer than perigynous zone
Flowers paired on peduncles; bracts 4 per inflorescence
Flowers solitary on peduncles; bracts 2 per inflorescence
Stems and bracts glabrous; leaves not fascicled; plant usually cushion-like, dense, compact
Stems and bracts with some hairs; leaves fascicled; plant usually prostrate, spreading, not dense or compact but straggly and lax
Sepals 4; stamens level with or exserted beyond sepals, long persistent
Flowers and fruit shortly pedicellate; sepals linear; plants annual, non-woody
Flowers and fruit sessile; sepals lanceolate; plants perennial with woody base
Stems and leaves with some hairs; stamens 2–7; leaves usually less than 0.7 mm wide with acute apex; fruit pedicel usually less than 1 mm long
Stems and leaves glabrous; stamens 2; leaves usually more than 0.5 mm wide with mucronate apex; fruit pedicel more than 1 mm long
